MCQ 1 Question for Myosin and Actin
object_data.value: In this video, the author will help you understand that the two proteins (Myosin and Actin) can work together with ATP to produce ________.

object_data.name: MCQ 1 Question for Myosin and Actin
object_data.value: Yes. That is correct! Later on the video will show you how it is done.

ATPtext1
object_data.value: Hint: What is this thing that binds to the Myosin head, which makes the Myosin coils and releases what?

object_data.name: ATPtext1
object_data.value:
Great! Here's a fun video analogy you can watch to explain how ATP makes the Myosin 'coils' and releases the Actin.
Click on Continue to continue watching the video

object_data.name: ATPtext1
object_data.value: What does ATP release after hydrolizing, aside from ADP and Pi?

object_data.name: ATPtext1
object_data.value:
Maybe the word hydrolizing makes you dizzy...
You might want to play the cool subvideo above about hydrolizing and how it will help you answer this question...
Or maybe you just ant to replay a part of the video

object_data.name: ATPtext1
object_data.value: Cool! This is how energy is made! You might want to see more how hydrolizing helps in releasing energy from ATP in the subvideo above

object_data.name: ATPtext1
object_data.value: Phosphate Group is released and Myosin pushes on Actin Filament

object_data.name: ATPtext1
object_data.value: ATP binds to Myosin ‘head’ and Myosin leaves Actin

object_data.name: ATPtext1
object_data.value: ATP is hydrolysed to ADP and the energy released moulds Myosin into a high energy shape to attach to the next rung of Actin Filament
